channel.title: NPR Topics: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Iran's protests appear increasingly smothered after a deadly crackdown
item.description: The nationwide protests challenging Iran's theocracy appear increasingly smothered a week after authorities shut the country off from the world and escalated a bloody crackdown.
item.content:encoded:
The nationwide protests challenging Iran's theocracy appear increasingly smothered a week after authorities shut the country off from the world and escalated a bloody crackdown.

(Image credit: Vahid Salemi)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: European troops arrive in Greenland to boost the Arctic island's security
item.description: Troops from several European countries, including France, Germany, Norway and Sweden, are arriving in Greenland after talks between Denmark, Greenland and the U.S. on Wednesday highlighted disagreement.
item.content:encoded:
Troops from several European countries, including France, Germany, Norway and Sweden, are arriving in Greenland after talks between Denmark, Greenland and the U.S. on Wednesday highlighted disagreement.

(Image credit: J. Scott Applewhite)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: What Teddy Roosevelt has to do with Trump's moves in Venezuela and Greenland
item.description: Presidents James Monroe and Theodore Roosevelt helped shape a policy that rationalizes U.S. intervention in Latin America and elsewhere. But Trump has brought that idea to a whole new level.
item.content:encoded:
Presidents James Monroe and Theodore Roosevelt helped shape a policy that rationalizes U.S. intervention in Latin America and elsewhere. But Trump has brought that idea to a whole new level.

(Image credit: William Allen Rogers)
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: Uganda goes to the polls amid heavy security and internet blackout
item.description: Ugandans are voting in a tense presidential election as 81-year-old President Yoweri Museveni seeks to extend his four-decade rule amid an internet shutdown and heavy military deployment.
item.content:encoded:
Ugandans are voting in a tense presidential election as 81-year-old President Yoweri Museveni seeks to extend his four-decade rule amid an internet shutdown and heavy military deployment.

(Image credit: Ben Curtis)
item.dc:creator: Emmanuel Akinwotu

item.title: Denmark and U.S. to form working group to talk about U.S. security concerns
item.description: After meeting with President Trump's top aides, Danish officials say they will form a working group to talk through U.S. security concerns about control of Greenland.
item.content:encoded: After meeting with President Trump's top aides, Danish officials say they will form a working group to talk through U.S. security concerns about control of Greenland.
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordoñez

item.title: Venezuelan opposition member Freddy Guevara talks about the future of his country
item.description: Freddy Guevara, former vice president of the Venezuelan Parliament and a member of the Venezuelan opposition, talks about what's next for his country.
item.content:encoded: Freddy Guevara, former vice president of the Venezuelan Parliament and a member of the Venezuelan opposition, talks about what's next for his country.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: U.S. says second phase of Gaza ceasefire has begun, but major challenges remain
item.description: The White House says the ceasefire deal between Israel and Hamas is moving into its second phase, which includes the demilitarization of Gaza, a key point in President Trump's peace plan.
item.content:encoded: The White House says the ceasefire deal between Israel and Hamas is moving into its second phase, which includes the demilitarization of Gaza, a key point in President Trump's peace plan.
item.dc:creator: Aya Batrawy

item.title: How the Trump administration's threats to Iran are stoking tensions in the region
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin talks to Vali Nasr, a professor of Middle East studies at Johns Hopkins University, about how President Trump's threats against Iran are escalating regional tensions.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Michel Martin talks to Vali Nasr, a professor of Middle East studies at Johns Hopkins University, about how President Trump's threats against Iran are escalating regional tensions.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Julio Iglesias accused of sexual assault as Spanish prosecutors study the allegations
item.description: Spanish prosecutors are studying allegations that Grammy-winning singer Julio Iglesias sexually assaulted two former employees at his residences in the Dominican Republic and the Bahamas.
item.content:encoded:
Spanish prosecutors are studying allegations that Grammy-winning singer Julio Iglesias sexually assaulted two former employees at his residences in the Dominican Republic and the Bahamas.

(Image credit: Carlos Giusti)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: How Trump's 'America First' is upending the world order
item.description: President Trump is dismantling the global system the U.S. built in the 20th century. Foreign policy experts say he wants a world that looks more like the 19th century.
item.content:encoded: President Trump is dismantling the global system the U.S. built in the 20th century. Foreign policy experts say he wants a world that looks more like the 19th century.
item.dc:creator: Greg Myre
